body:
Tested the same setup on Next 14.2.22, the default cache for static pages are working correctly at 5 minutes. Every 5 minutes if you hover over the random number button you will see in the network tab a new rsc request. 
For custom stale time it kind of worked, I specified 10, but the actual requests always happen every 30 seconds.

So there must be a bug in Next 15, where the client side router cache remains fresh forever.
@a89529294 i also have same problem in nextjs 15. Did u solve it?

> @a89529294 i also have same problem in nextjs 15. Did u solve it?

I had to make the page a dynamic page, so it won't be cached on the client side at all.
Hi @samcx , any reason to remove the `bug` label? It's still reproducible using Next.js 15.2.3, while this behaves correctly in 14.2.25.

@BIT-zhaoyang I've been opting out the old `bug` label for the newer GitHub **Types**.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7840b207-6fac-4b96-abb7-4ea4f067b8a2)

issue.title: Client router should discard stale prefetch entries for static pages
issue.body:
When navigating to a static page that was previously prefetched, the client router should discard a stale prefetch entry, and fetch the page again, if the stale time has passed.

The selected stale time is either the default value of 5 minutes, a custom value set via `experimental.staleTimes.static`, or a stale value set via a `cacheLife` profile when using `"use cache"`.

This also fixes an issue where the client router interpreted the stale time value as milliseconds, whereas the server sends it in seconds. This was previously already fixed with `clientSegmentCache` enabled in #74759.

fixes #74272
fixes #79093
Closes NEXT-4109

body: This closed issue has been automatically locked because it had no new activity for 2 weeks. If you are running into a similar issue, please create a new issue with the steps to reproduce. Thank you.

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
